title.narrative: Conference on Mena Trends in Arab politics after the 2011 uprisings

description.narrative:
The project will map and analyse the main tendencies and conflict lines that define the Middle East and North Africa region today by gathering international experts for a public conference. The overall outcome will be the dissemination of major tendencies in Arab politics today, presented publicly in form of an event and a briefing document. Finally the conference will be followed up by a longer policy report for internal use in the MoFA. This report should provide policy recommendations for Danish engagement in the MENA region.
The project will include an assesment of the following issues: - Mapping and analysing the most prominent political trends and tendencies currently marking the Middle East and North Africa region. - Describing and analysing the potentials for continued peaceful contentious politics. - Describing and analysing how local, regional and international actors may engage politically in the region. - Provide policy recommendations focused on Danish engagement with the regoin.
